topFaq.title: Frequently asked questions
topFaq.content: Read our FAQ here or download our [poster](assets/images/FAQ.pdf)

signupCard.title: Participate
signupCard.body: Help us keep an eye on coronavirus. Report weekly whether you have any symptoms.

surveyCard.title: Report now!
surveyCard.body: Report whether you have any symptoms.

faq.title: What is CoughWatchSA all about?
faq.content: CoughWatchSA is a web application designed for monitoring respiratory illness in South Africa. Anyone in South Africa can take part. Participants are asked to report on a weeklybasis if they have any symptoms or not inorder to identify possible new spreads of u (and other respiratory infections). For more information about CWSA, and what it involves, see the project

faq.title: How should I choose a username and password?
faq.content: You will need a working email address in order to register which will serve as your username and a chosen password. If you have forgotten your password or username, you can request a new password through the web platform.

faq.title: Is all data anonymous? Who can see the information I send?
faq.content: Yes. All data is completely anonymised upon submission, it will not be possible to link the information provided to any individual or household.

faq.title: Where is my data stored?
faq.content: After being anonymised, data is stored in a secure data layer on our servers (Google Cloud) and only the study team will have access to your data in an anonymised manner

faq.title: Who are you gathering data for and who benefits?
faq.content: Two groups bene t from this information immediately. First, citizens like yourself, who gain access to valuable information about respiratory cases in your community. This information allows you to prepare and react quickly to risks in your community. Second, the National Institute for Communicable Diseases, for the purpose of preparation, outbreak detection, and targeted response

faq.title: Can I invite my colleagues, peers of family?
faq.content: Yes, please invite as many others as you can. More data means more powerful models and better outputs and results

faq.title: Can I answer the survey for other people?
faq.content: Yes, only on behalf of your children if you are the parent or legal guardian. You will register using a valid email account and through your account, you can add other pro les which will be recognised as users linked to your account

faq.title: What if I am away or unable to answer the survey for some time? Will I be disqualified?
faq.content: No, please just resume answering the survey as soon as possible. The survey links are sent via email so you can complete these anywhere in the world

faq.title: Can I change my email address?
faq.content: No, accounts are linked directly to an email. If you to change your email you would need to create a new account and unsubscribe from the current account.

faq.title: How secure is the system?
faq.content: All connections are secured using HTTPS. Only encrypted passwords are stored.

faq.title: Will I be able to use the platform offline?
faq.content: No, you cannot submit your responses offline, but the web platform is zero-rated which means you will not incur any mobile data expenses

faq.title: Who is eligible to participate in this platform?
faq.content: Anyone over the age of 18 can participate today and they can now add pro les for their children

faq.title: I think I have COVID-19, will this platform help me?
faq.content: No, this platform is for measuring trends and potential problem areas across the population. If you think you have COVID-19 and need medical assistance, please call visit your nearest clinic or consult your doctor.

faq.title: If I move to another area, will I be able to update my postal code?
faq.content: Yes, you will be able to update your postal code through the intake questionnaire.

faq.title: I live in the rural areas, will I be able to participate?
faq.content: Yes, the accuracy of the forecasting depends on having input from a wide range of people - in terms of age, gender, health, and location

faq.title: Should I report on my symptoms when I am away from home?
faq.content: Generally, Yes. We often don't know exactly where we were infected, so if in doubt report what you have. Also, we're trying to get people's infection pro les over the whole season. However, when you are moving abroad, we would ask you to stop completing the survey.
